document.docAuthor: Larson, Helen K., Jaafar, Zeehan & Lim, Kelvin K. P.
document.masterDocTitle: An Annotated Checklist Of The Gobioid Fishes Of Singapore

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: An Annotated Checklist Of The Gobioid Fishes Of Singapore

subSubSection.paragraph:
Poecilia fusca Bloch & Schneider, 1801: 453
(Oriadeae infulae rivulis [= Pacific Seas]).
Remarks: No recent material from Singapore observed.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Eleotris melanosoma Bleeker, 1852b: 705
(Wahai, Ceram; Sumatra occidentalis).

subSubSection.paragraph: Remarks: No recent material from Singapore observed.
Remarks: No recent material from Singapore observed.

Eleotris margaritacea Valenciennes, 1837: 240 (Vanikolo)
.
Eleotris aporos
– Karoli, 1882: 167 (Sarangoon).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Ophiocara aporos –
Fowler, 1938: 209
(Serangoon).
Ophioeleotris aporos
– Lim & Larson, 1994: 260 ( Singapore ). Remarks: No recent material from Singapore observed.

subSubSection.paragraph: ZRC material from: Woodleigh, Sime Road forest, Lower Peirce Reservoir, Nee Soon swamp forest, Lorong Banir, Sungei Seletar, Upper Seletar Reservoir, Sungei Punggol, Serangoon.

Remarks: It is possible that this species was introduced in Singapore , as the earliest record is Tweedie’s (1936) and it is unlikely that such an important large and edible species could have been overlooked by earlier collectors.
ZRC material from: Sungei Berih, Sungei Buloh, Sungei Punggol,
